articles.description: In a significant breakthrough for vaccine research, a flu jab grown in plants has passed two large-scale clinical trials. Researchers extracted virus-like particles from tobacco plants to create the inoculation.
articles.content: The boffins used native Australian tobacco relatives that were genetically modified to create the viral proteins. The two trials involved nearly 23,000 people and the results indicated that the plant… [+1873 chars]

articles.author: Laurence Roope, Philip Clarke
articles.title: Odds and evens: a strategy for safely exiting lockdown 2 - The Conversation UK
articles.description: A cyclical lockdown policy based on odd and even house numbers could be the best way to exit the lockdown.
articles.content: As the Danish physicist Niels Bohr once warned, it is difficult to make predictions, especially about the future. This warning is particularly true when it comes to the epidemiology of COVID-19. In t… [+5101 chars]
